Articles.Content:
KSP has a space plane hanger for a reason, Right? That reason is to make spaceplanes. Now a lot of kerbal engineershave built planes, but they seem to be vary kerbalish.( explosions, missing parts etc). I talked with a kerbal yesterday and he said ( in a very hard to understand language) that it is impossible to build a spaceplanes without it looking like it it crashed a zillion times before it even rolls out of the hanger. Your challenge is to build a spaceplanes that has a practical purpose, yet looks good and ethical.

RULES:

1: Mods that seem unfair are not allowed

2: do not copy designs from other people

3: list the real world purpose, craft file, and screenshots of your design

4: spaceplanes must take off horizontally

5: do not believe everything you read above!

ACHIVMENTS

Most unique design

Best use of parts- have the least amount of parts

Modless- use only stock parts

Kreator- best overall design and real world purpose

Waster- have the most parts

Define "unfair" for mods. For example, my plugin completely changes the lift and drag models and sets them to more realistic values, as opposed to the current unphysical aerodynamic models. Would it qualify as "unfair" under your definition? (Just asking, because I have a bunch of planes that I could submit, but all of them use the plugin )
